definition: liuqin lute, smaller version of the pipa 琵琶, with holes in the soundbox, and range similar to that of a violin
surname Liu
willow
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: Pavlyuchenko may have stuttered in north London, but his pedigree is good.
sentences.chinese: 帕夫柳琴科在北倫敦過的不愉快但是他的實力很不錯。

sentences.english: More likely, perhaps, is a loan move for Tottenham's Russian misfit Roman Pavlyuchenko.
sentences.chinese: 或許比較現實的是從熱刺租借帕夫柳琴科。

sentences.english: Roma are interested in Spartak Moscow striker Roman Pavlyuchenko.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬對莫斯科斯巴達前鋒帕夫柳琴科感興趣。

sentences.english: In the sphere of modern art creation, the artistic vitality of Liuqin is comparatively strong, hence enjoys a promising prospect.
sentences.chinese: 在現代創作領域中的柳琴藝術生命力較強，前景光明。

sentences.english: There was an interesting contrast between Emmanuel Adebayor and Roman Pavlyuchenko.
sentences.chinese: 阿德巴約和帕夫柳琴科之間的比較很有意思。

definition: yangqin/dulcimer (hammered string musical instrument)
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
erhu (Chinese 2-string fiddle)/alto fiddle/CL:把[ba3]
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
variant of 揚琴|扬琴[yang2 qin2]
(Western) concert flute
bamboo flute/CL:管[guan3]
